item.title: Commemorating the 200th anniversary of the birth of Abraham Lincoln, the 16th President of the United States of America.

latestAction.text: Referred to the House Committee on Oversight and Government Reform.

item.title: Commemorating the life and legacy of President Abraham Lincoln on the bicentennial of his birth.

latestAction.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

item.text: Submitted in the Senate, considered, and agreed to without amendment and with a preamble by Unanimous Consent. (consideration: CR S2169-2170; text as passed Senate: CR S2169-2170; text of measure as introduced: CR S2248)

Passed/agreed to in Senate: Submitted in the Senate, considered, and agreed to without amendment and with a preamble by Unanimous Consent.(consideration: CR S2169-2170; text as passed Senate: CR S2169-2170; text of measure as introduced: CR S2248)

summary.text:
Commemorates the bicentennial of the birth of President Abraham Lincoln.

Recognizes his commitment to unity and harmony in the United States.

Encourages the people of the United States to recommit to fulfilling his vision of equal rights for all.

(This measure has not been amended since it was introduced. The summary of that version is repeated here.)

Commemorates the bicentennial of the birth of President Abraham Lincoln.

Recognizes his commitment to unity and harmony in the United States.

Encourages the people of the United States to recommit to fulfilling his vision of equal rights for all.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
